article_text:
ZURICH—Roche Holding AG said Monday it was buying Danish biopharmaceutical firm Santaris Pharma for as much $450 million, as the Swiss giant looks for ways to develop drugs for diseases difficult to address with existing medicines.

Roche, based in Basel, Switzerland, said in a statement that it would make an initial cash payment of $250 million for privately held Santaris, which specializes in relatively new RNA-targeting...

twitter.description: Roche will pay an initial $250 million and further payments of up to $200 million for the Danish biopharmaceutical company, which specializes in so-called RNA-targeting therapeutics
twitter.creator: @letzing

image.alt: Roche to buy Danish biopharmaceutical company Santaris Pharma for up to $450 million

twitter.title: Roche to Buy Santaris Pharma
